channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: New videos show how Covid-19 slowed New Zealand's pulse
item.description: The visualisations down to suburb level show most people are "behaving themselves" and staying home, data analysts say.

item.title: Covid-19: Live updates from New Zealand and around the world on 24 April
item.description: There will be an increased police presence around the country, including checkpoints along routes to popular holiday destinations. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest.

item.title: Kiwi scientist behind frontrunner Covid-19 treatment
item.description: A New Zealand scientist has created the compound which is now a front runner as a treatment option for Covid-19.

item.title: Kiwis find alternative ways to celebrate Anzac Day
item.description: Anzac Day services around the country have been shelved and veterans won't be able to join together because of the Covid-19 restrictions, but that won't stop people celebrating.

item.title: Covid-19: People responding to PM's call to get tested
item.description: Record numbers of people have been turning up at some Covid-19 testing centres, many with the most minor of symptoms.

item.title: Most people turning to Salvation Army are doing so for first time
item.description: The Salvation Army is warning of an "emerging underclass" of people who have suddenly found themselves in hardship because of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 23 April
item.description: The number of new Covid-19 cases has dropped, but unemployment is on the rise as the country prepares to move out of alert level 4, and hoping the economy will pick up.

item.title: Businesses pay back wage subsidy: 'It's not a time to be greedy'
item.description: The government's wage subsidy scheme has been paid to nearly 1000 companies who should not have received it.

item.title: Cafés and restaurants seek alternative to Uber Eats as level 3 looms
item.description: With alert level 3 approaching, small, independent restaurants and cafés are coming up with new ways of making sure they can still deliver to hungry customers.

item.title: Tourism job cuts a 'horror story' for Queenstown - mayor
item.description: The mayor of Queenstown Lakes has described plans to cut hundreds of tourism jobs as a horror show.

item.title: Disability employer Altus' redundancy package: a story with no winners
item.description: Lockdown has led Altus Enterprises to make 137 of its disabled employees redundant, leaving workers and company leadership alike heartbroken.

item.title: Len Lye Centre co-directors quit to return home
item.description: The first-ever co-directors of the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery / Len Lye Centre in New Plymouth have quit after barely a year in the job.

item.title: NZers more trusting in news outlets than other countries - survey
item.description: A new report finds New Zealanders have a relatively high trust in news compared to other developed countries, despite "strong concerns" about poor journalism in this country.

item.title: As it happened: Latest Covid-19 news from NZ and around the world
item.description: The number of new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand continues to fall, but the death toll is still on the rise. See how the day unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: 'We need to continue to stick to the rules' - Police Commissioner
item.description: Police have dealt with 4452 breaches since the lockdown began, including 423 in the past 24 hours. Watch the latest update from the Police Commissioner and Civil Defence director here.

item.title: Family considers legal action against cruise operator after man dies
item.description: The family of a couple who caught Covid-19 on a cruise are considering legal action against the ship's operator Royal Caribbean.

item.title: Apology to family after Invercargill woman dies of Covid-19
item.description: A 62-year-old Invercargill woman has died in Dunedin Hospital, with the director general of health apologising to the family after her condition was mistakenly described as stable.

item.title: Covid-19: Three new cases in NZ, two further deaths reported
item.description: Three new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in NZ in the past 24 hours, with the Health Ministry also confirming two further deaths from the coronavirus.
